Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014005016.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2007, Jason Adam was seen for the last time near the Shaw Conference Center in Edmonton, Alberta. Jason left a family member’s residence on foot to meet with an ex-girlfriend for coffee. On the previous day, Jason had traveled from Lac La Biche, Alberta to Edmonton to attend a guardianship court hearing on October 22, 2007, but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent
Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)

Case reference: 2012020127.CaseDesc: Jocelyne Dubé, 57, was last seen on October 2nd 2008. On the night of her disappearance, she received a phone call from a friend and a visit from her daughter at her Piedmont, Quebec residence.  A few days after the disappearance, her abandoned vehicle was found in Montreal, Quebec. Everything indicates that the car had been there for a few days.

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005555.CaseDesc: In April, 2000, Magdalena Ciesek was last seen in Toronto, Ontario at the intersection of Dundas Street W. and Roncesvalles Avenue.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, Saskatchewan, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Raymond has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020069.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1982, a Gimli resident reported that in 1972 Debbie Richardson arrived in Gimli to visit her brother.  According to this report, she stayed with him for approximately three months, then went missing. Debbie's brother last saw her in September, 1972, when he dropped her off on a highway so that she could hitchhike to Winnipeg.  She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2000000183.CaseDesc: Matthew was last seen at a truck stop in Sicamous in British Columbia, Canada.

Case reference: 2022019657.CaseDesc: On January 9, 1989, Richard Figura was seen for the last time near the brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Richard was despondent.

Case reference: 2022010303.CaseDesc: On January 6, 2022, Jeannine Ermineskin was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta’s downtown area.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Love, eagle, feather, lady with headdress
Right Upper Arm, Crown, diamond, flower, stars  and feathers
Left Upper Arm, Eagle, female face and a rose
Right Hand, The word "LOVE" on knuckles
Right Side Of Neck, Cursive text "Daniel"

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014005108.CaseDesc: On May 20, 2008, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Zhebglin Park was seen for the last time at his home in the Tom Clove Villa Residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005491.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2010, Michael Blakney was seen for the last time on a forest trail in the Scoudouc area of New Brunswick.

Deformity: Left Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin Arsenault went missing from 172 Sydney Street, in Saint John, New Brunswick (Rooming House). Benjamin was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top
Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2020040389.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1947, Rosella DeLong was seen for the last time leaving her family home in Toronto, Ontario. Rosella intended on travelling to the USA to take a course and to buy equipment to start a weight loss clinic.

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.

Case reference: 2014002341.CaseDesc: On June 23, 1979, Terrence Henderson was last seen canoeing on Lac St. Anne in Ross Haven, Alberta.

Case reference: 2023012025.CaseDesc: On March 6th, 2023 shortly after 12:00 pm, Kimberly Jackson was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Kimberly was despondent.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Samurai skull with a knife

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2013000065.CaseDesc: Pierrette Courcelles was last seen on November 22, 1991 in Montreal.

Tattoo: Right Arm, picture of a heart, a cross and an eagle with "ROBERT" (text)

Case reference: 2016012810.CaseDesc: On March 12th, 2016 shortly after midnight, Denny Poole and a friend left Dawson Creek with the intent of heading to Fort St John. It is unknown if they intended to walk, hitchhike, or had other means to get there. The duo became disoriented and ended up wandering the highway and back roads for over 20 hours. It was learned that neither of them was prepared to be out for this period of time. At some point, Denny and his friend had a difference of opinion on whether they should continue on their journey or not, and the two ended up separating. The last confirmed sighting of Denny was just south of the Kiskatinaw Bridge on Highway 97. Denny has some disabilities and it is recommended that he be under adult supervision.

Shoes: Black, Purple, green and white "Osiris" brand
Sweater: Grey, Dark grey hoodie with red "DGK" symbol

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Russell Peter Yellowbird was reported missing by his family in February 2015 after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for an extended period. It is believed that his last known location was in the downtown area of Edmonton, Alberta. Given the unusual circumstances of his disappearance, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest any foul play.

Case reference: 2014005501.CaseDesc: On October 7, 2010 around midnight, Fred Byram was last seen exiting the Rockin Rodeo bar and getting into a taxi on Elmwood Drive in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Hair: Grey, Brush Cut, Salt and Pepper hair, 2-3-day stubble
Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Blue wolf and moon with tree
Right Wrist, Barbwire, green and grey

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2014004062.CaseDesc: Steve Langlois left the Gascon's dock at Port Daniel on April 27, 1996 on a lobster fishing boat. The boat was then hit by a wave and capsized. Mr. Langlois has not been found.

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2013000104.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Johnson Beardy. It is assumed Johnson took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014004451.CaseDesc: On February 22, 1964, Marie Mike was seen for the last time leaving a residence on the Beardy's/Okemasis First Nation Reserve near Rosthern, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2013000016.CaseDesc: Marjorie Ferris was reported missing when she did not show up in London, Ontario, where she was to visit friends. Her apartment was found secured and intact with her purse inside. Her vehicle was parked in the underground garage at her building. Extensive investigation failed to uncover any information regarding her disappearance.

Teeth: False, Full upper and lower dentures

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005807.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2012, Marc St-Laurent was seen for the last time on a bench outside the grocery store at Place Quévillon in Lebel-sur-Quévillon, Quebec. His pick-up, a white 1992 GMC Sierra, was located on 26 July 2012, in a federated snowmobile trail, approximately three kilometres from Lebel-sur-Quévillon.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Following his arrival to Canada from Serbia, Bojan was employed as a mechanical engineer, and a professor at the University of Toronto. Around the time of his disappearance, Bojan had informed his family that he would not be able to contact them for an extended period of time due to unknown reasons.

Case reference: 2014001638.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1977, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Norman Louison was last seen walking to a residence on the Cowessess First Nation near Broadview, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: Martin Maier was last seen on May 4, 1973, leaving the local hotel in Prelate, Saskatchewan at approximately 1:00 a.m. He was driving a red 1971 Chevrolet half-ton pick-up Saskatchewan license F133013 with a white camper on the cargo box.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Martin or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash brand with a fish design, knitted

Case reference: 2014006077.CaseDesc: Schuyler Bierkos was last seen by his roommate at his home in Calgary, Alberta on February 24, 2013. The reason for his disapearance is unknown.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Usually has a beard
Scar: Head, severe acne and scars on face

Case reference: 2014005144.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2008, Esther De Kiewit was reported missing after her mail was not being picked up from the Post Office in Boston Bar, British Columbia. She led a transient lifestyle and was living in an abandoned travel trailer in a forested area outside of Boston Bar. Esther moved throughout the back country frequently and is believed to have last been at her trailer in April of 2008. Esther suffered from mental health issues and seizures.  She was known to dress entirely in black.

Case reference: 2014005157.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2008, Heinz Meyer was seen for the last time in Haines Junction located in the Yukon. His vehicle was later found on Marshall Creek Road in Haines Junction.

Jacket: Cloth, Dark Green, Light Green, Camouflage

Case reference: 2014006535.CaseDesc: On the 11th of July, 1972, Edward Nemanishen was last seen by co-workers at a work site approximately 12 km North West of Spruce Home in the Alingly District of Saskatchewan. Edward was working at the site clearing farmland at 1:30 pm. A co-worker returned to the work site at 7:00 pm and Edward was gone from the site. No one has seen or heard from him since that time.

Boots: Brown, Work boot; lace up; size 8
Sweater: Dark Green, Pullover with half zipper
Deformity: Ears, white lump behind right ear; the size of a pea

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2015052895.CaseDesc: Ujjvalkumar Patel was last seen on June 15, 2015 at his workplace in Brampton, ON. Ujjvalkumar was attending college in Ontario. He told his landlord he was returning to India for a family emergency but never showed up.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2012020654.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1997, Darold Kishayinew was last seen at a relative’s house in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006025499.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1976, Anthony Malinak and friends arrived at Long Lake and fished during the day. That evening Mr. Malinak had taken a boat from Mountain Lodge on Long Lake. The boat was found at the east end of the lake in a foot of water.  Mr. Malinak's rain jacket and hat were found in the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim
Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2010001399.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2009, Trevor Andrews was seen for the last time when he left a friend's house in a residential area of London, Ontario, intending to catch a bus to go home. He never returned home to his father's apartment. It cannot be confirmed that he got on the bus. Trevor is known to be very sociable. He would be noticed because of his energetic behaviour. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2011002399.CaseDesc: Cynthia Sunga was last seen at her family home on Donald street, on or about August 25, 2005.  She was reported missing to the Ottawa Police on November 11, 2005, by a family member.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Molar number 16 Upper missing, removed in 2000. The records of the bordering teeth available.
Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal heart - Chinese characters for strong

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Coat: Blue, Winter, Possibly wearing a puffy royal blue coat

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2008002599.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1991, William Caswell and his daughter were boating on Panache Lake when they were both suddenly thrown into the water. Mr. Caswell's daughter managed to swim ashore but William is still missing and is presumed drowned. Panache Lake is located east of Espanola and West of Sudbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top
Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom
Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.

Case reference: 2014003255.CaseDesc: On September 06, 1976, Charles Lewsaw was seen for the last time near Newmack well site located 8 km North of Red Earth Creek, Alberta.

Foreign Object: Right Forearm, Rod in arm from elbow to wrist

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978, at his residence in Edson, Alberta. His motorcycle and helmet were found approximately one month later in a remote region southwest of Sundre, Alberta. Ronald may have been observed on foot in the vicinity shortly afterward, however he was never located.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2021047780.CaseDesc: Vincent McLean was last seen on October 1, 2021, at a rural property where he resided in Two Hills County, Alberta. There has been no activity from him since that date.

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2014003793.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1980, Keith Dufour was seen for the last time at his residence in the town of Amherstburg, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Forehead, Right temple on the forehead

Case reference: 2006006199.CaseDesc: Donald Douma has been missing since May 19, 1981. Donald was an avid outdoorsman and he occasionally hitchiked. He was last seen leaving home on a blue CCM bicycle. Donald Douma had expressed interest in moving out West and his family believes that is where he may have gone to.

Teeth: Crooked, Some dental work, upper front tooth has had some white fillings.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach
Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2019040192.CaseDesc: The skull belonging to an adult male was found on a beach near Ucluelet, British Columbia in October 1980. The man had a strong jawline and had a visible gap in his teeth on the upper left side. It is believed he was deceased several years prior to skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2022005006.CaseDesc: In February 2021, Deana Timms was last seen in London, Ontario. Deana’s family and friends have not heard from her since this time. It is out of character for her to not be in contact with her loved ones for such an extended time.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Visible missing lower teeth
Scar: Left Index Finger, On the ring finger

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Scar: Ears, Surgical scar behind the ear

Case reference: 2014004759.CaseDesc: On March 21st 2006, Tayven Bear was playing with two other children on the ice of the Churchill River in Sandy Bay, Saskatchewan. Tayven fell into the river and he was never recovered.

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.
